person.persName: Major Willa Viley Johnson (Son of George Washington Johnson and Ann Eliza Viley)

body.p: Born in Georgetown, Scott County, Kentucky, son of Provisional Governor George Washington Johnson and Ann Eliza Viley. Married Lilly Tilford. Entered the Confederate army on April 20, 1862, as aid-de-camp to Gen. John C. Breckinridge. Later transferred to the western division of the army under Gen. George Crosby and afterwards to Gen. Frank Armstrong. Served with Gen. Armstrong until the end of the Civil War. Promoted to the rank of Major shortly after the battle of Jackson, Mississippi. Paroled at Vicksburg, Mississippi on May 3, 1865.
